title: Pygmalion / C.R.I.S.T.A.L.L.
description: A minimally viable space of experience. The MVP is not a product or a system. It is a form of observing non-material human participation without money, coercion, or evaluation.
mvp_intro: MVP is not a product and not a system. It is a demonstration of principle and a space of personal experience.
mvp_what_body: MVP demonstrates the possibility of recognizing non-material human participation without money, coercion, KPI, or obligations.
mvp_structure_body: MVP represents a complete chain of human experience: intention, action, attention fixation, reflection, and understanding. MVP is the whole chain, not a single act.
mvp_participants_body: MVP can be experienced individually or with 2–5 participants. Participation is fully voluntary. Interpretation belongs to the participant.
mvp_not_body: MVP does not fix daily results, does not impose obligations, does not rank people, and does not simulate a full platform.
mvp_ethics_body: MVP is based on voluntary participation, liberated labor, respect for human attention and time, and the principle of numerical restraint instead of digital expansion.
mvp_table_note: A kon is a moment of attention fixation. It does not measure value and does not require interpretation.
